reference: Ahuja, R. K., Magnanti, T. L., & Orlin, J. B. (1993). Network Flows: Theory, Algorithms, and Applications.
natural_language_example: Consider a transportation network with 3 cities (A, B, C) and 2 products (P1, P2). City A has a supply of 50 units of P1 and 30 units of P2, while City B requires 40 units of P1 and 20 units of P2. The cost of shipping P1 from A to B is $5 per unit, and the capacity for P1 on this link is 100 units. The joint capacity for all products on the link from A to B is 150 units. The goal is to minimize the total shipping cost while satisfying supply, demand, and capacity constraints.
